Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (5 of 365)  I was pleasantly suprised by how flavorful and yummy everything we ordered was!  My friend and I came here over the weekend at around 3pm; so no one was in the restaurant.  We ordered: Pad See Ew Beef, Garlic Short Ribs, and Papaya Salad.  The salad was refreshing, the short ribs had a great crispy texture on it and wasn't too salty; just the right amount of garlic flavor, and the Pad See Ew was one of the best I've ever tasted!  It was full of flavor, had an abundance of egg which I love, and you get to choose whether you want american or Chinese broccoli.  Awesome!  The only downside was they didn't have any mango at the time we were there; and it's in season!  Not good.  I would have given it 5 stars if they had it!  But I'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Author: Bianca
Reviews.Content: FREE refills on the thai tea!!!!! They have a lunch special everyday I believe. Between 11-3! I always get the Ginger Ginger Ginger dish! Also comes with a light vegetable soup, small eggroll, and a salad (salad is just shredded lettuce...no dressing or anything!!!!!)

Reviews.Author: Kristen
Reviews.Content: I alway order delivery. This place is awesome. The food is always hot and fresh. I haven't had anything yet that I don't like. I definitely recommend this restaurant. Staff is always friendly.

Reviews.Author: Yu
Reviews.Content: I order from this location occasionally. The food is OK, and the portion is usually generous. However, I give the restaurant only two stars based on my last two experiences with them. One time I ordered some lunch specials to go including a beef Pad Thai. When I started to eat I immediately noticed the beef was spoiled and tasted disgusting. It's not just not fresh it's literally spoiled. So I threw the entire box away. The second time I placed the order online for pickup at about 7:45 pm. When I arrived the restaurant at 8:10 they appeared to forget about my order. I waited in the lobby and expected my order to be ready in 10 mins as the restaurant was only 1/3 full. However, I waited until almost 9 PM! They gave me a free Thai tea for my wait and I guess that's why I hesitate to give them a 1 star.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: This place is delicious!! I've seen this place a few times and finally decided to stop in for dinner, I'm glad I did. The food is great and all of the staff and servers were super friendly! I had the crab wontons to start, the shrimp pad thai, boyfriend had the Bbq pork soup everything was delicious, can't wait to come back again and try more food!!

Reviews.Author: Jimmy
Reviews.Content: It was really, really good. And really, really close to our place. Which is why they get...5 stars!   Came in toward the end of the night, party of 2. We were seated quick...the staff and Chef (see below) were great and attentive.  Ordered:  Yellow Curry Fettuccine Alfredo...I know! Fettuccine Alfredo in a Thai place?!? Thats what made me want to try it and it didnt disappoint. Though I had to order a side of steamed rice to help with the spice, cus no i didnt have an option of choosing a spice level. But, I would order it again.  Divine Scallops....4 scallops on the plate. God, they melted like butter in my mouth...but again. It was too spicy for my like. So I ate some rice with them. Lol it helps!   BBQ Chicken....it was about 3-4 pieces of chicken, comes with its own rice. What can I say? Its a classic. It was great.   For Dessert: We werent going to order any however the Chef happened to be taking a breather while we were having dinner and after a good 15-20 minute conversation about work and life, to our surprise he sent us some dessert, on the house! It was.....  Banana dipped in tempura and deep fried, on the plate came strawberry sauce and on the side a large scoop of fresh coconut ice cream. Wow it was delicious and next time ill order it.

Reviews.Author: Kristi
Reviews.Content: I love this place.  The inside is beautiful,  ambient,  and very clean. It's never been overly busy (which is nice because it's quiet).  Service is always great.   Food is awesome and spices are always on par with what you request.  The spring rolls are to die for. Also,  the Thai iced coffee with milk is DELICIOUS!

Reviews.Author: Teri
Reviews.Content: Another Thai restaurant experience - lunch specials are the way to go I tell you!  First off, Panna Thai Restaurant looks a bit more upscale than your average Thai joint, which I think reflects in the price as well.  We walked in to a relatively empty restaurant on a weekday.  As the waiter brought us to our table, he immediately asked if we had any coupons (before we even sat down).  We did not, but apparently they do have a lot floating around and are a bit restrictive about how they are used.  I think they are also on restaurant.com too.  Lunch specials are available everyday from 11 am to 4 pm.  They all include a fried wonton, fresh salad, steamed rice, and soup of the day.  (You can substitute fried rice or brown rice for $1 more.)    Started off with miso soup.  Interesting choice.   I went for the Yellow Curry Lunch Special with Tofu  Thai yellow curry and Thai herbs served with Jasmine rice.  ($6.95).   Fried tofu and potatoes were the main components of my dish.  Raw bell peppers decorated the top.  I wished they cooked the veggies with the curry though.  The fried wonton had peas and carrots in it - a bit different than what you normally find inside one of those things.  The biggest problem I had was with the rice.  It was mushy - too much water in the cooker!  It's never a good sign when the rice gets messed up!   The Husband tried out their Garlic Short Ribs Lunch Special  Deep fried short ribs sauteed with garlic and black pepper sauce served with Jasmine rice.  ($6.95)  It was a tasty dish and lots of flavor, but then again it's deep fried and it sounds like it would be tasty.  Overall, we found Panna Thai to be just an okay experience.  There are definitely a few other Thai restaurants in the neighborhood that has a foot up on selection, taste, and price.

Reviews.Author: Cookie
Reviews.Content: This place has new owners and the food is now terrible. I don't know why people keep eating here there are so many good Thai restaurants around here... I guess people are just stupid, or they're all smokers who have killed their taste buds and can't tell the difference.  I used to go here all the time but now I will avoid it like the plague!

Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: Wow!  We drive out of our way to eat here when we are staying on the Strip. Best thai food that I've had in Nevada. Huge portions too.   The peanut sauce is made fresh to order and is the tastiest I have experienced.   The soup and fresh rolls are also good with evidence of  fresh cut veggies  Get the basil chicken medium spicy and you'll be good to go.  Service can be a pain during busy hours however.

Reviews.Author: Amaris
Reviews.Content: The restaurant has a nice ambiance and you did not feel like you were too close to other diners. My party of 4 was quickly seated and our server promptly brought our drinks. I had a vanilla chai tea and it was amazing! I am a huge tea fan and I really could have knocked back 2 before my meal arrived. For my appetizer, I ordered the summer rolls and they were delicious. I absolutely love the taste of mint with the tangy peanut sauce. My main course consisted of the yellow curry with potatoes, coconut milk, and tofu. The curry had great flavor and even though I ordered it spicy, the peppers were not overbearing. If you are not really into spice, you can order no spice.   The only slight negative was our server appeared to be working a large amount of tables by herself, so she was rushing and some of the plates had a rough  landing  on our table. It was no big deal and other than that, it was a positive experience.

Reviews.Author: Bradley
Reviews.Content: I love this place! I have almost tried everything on their menu and have loved everything. My favorite is the Chicken Saute. Everyone who works there is great, food is great, and it's clean!

Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Just swung in to get some Pad Thai to go. Nice place and still seemed busy after the lunch rush.   My Pad Thai was mediocre. Not bad but I wouldn't order it again. I ordered it  spicy  which equated to  a little bit of heat  in my mind. Take that for what it's worth. Also, my wife says she only gets curries here and they are very good.

Reviews.Author: Esther
Reviews.Content: It's the 2nd time we ate here. First time we came was based off Yelp reviews and the fact that we just live down the road next to Wet n Wild. My husband and I are vegetarians but not strict enough to worry about fish sauce or similar stuff like that. We mostly just order the food with tofu instead of meat or seafood. This place does it well. Very much comparable to our favourite Thai place which is just a little further from home - Archi's on Rainbow.  The first time we came, I ordered the lunch special - both of us agreed that the soup that came with it was so tasty! I had the Pad Thai and he had the tofu Panang Curry. Both delicious!!  Today we tried the Summer Rolls with peanut sauce!! OMG YUM! Will definitely order it again!

Reviews.Author: Ethel
Reviews.Content: This place has really great yellow curry. Tom yum was not the greatest I've ever had. The vegetable spring rolls were amazing and fresh. Thai tea was good too. The ambiance in this place was great. It is a great Thai restaurant not in the strip area.

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was going to be amazing after seeing these reviews. I have ordered twice from here and both times it's super disappointing not good at all!! How is Thai food bland. Tom Ka soup tasted like sugar water w boiled chicken w raw button mushrooms (didn't know those were Thai) papaya salad is pretty hard to mess up but it's horrible. Waste of money so sick and was looking forward to this. Such a let down. Don't believe the hype!!

Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: So this is the 3rd restaurant we hit for my birthday dinner marathon.  =)  The food really deserved the 5 star rating, and I'd take 0.5 star off for the waitress failing to refill our water/tea.  Since I had to round it, 4 star it is.  The three of us ordered one appetizer, one salad, and two entrees.  Satay Combo - two beef and two chicken skewers grilled to perfection!  I'd say that Panna Thai delivered the juiciest beef Satay in town!  Yum-wun-sen (the silver noodle salad) - there were only 4 shrimps in this salad and no any other seafood.  I'd say this is seasoned to appeal to the locals since it did taste kind of   americanized.   BBQ Spare Rib - Fork tender and falls right off the bone!  The sweet BBQ sauce wasn't just poured on, it was completely absorbed by the meat itself.  Sweety Duck -  I have to give this two thumbs up.  I'd say we eat duck pretty often since we visit the Cantonese restaurants in town all the time.  The Sweety Duck is up there with the tops, if not, even better!   The decor and atmosphere are WAY better than the Noodle House 2 that's only one block away.  We'd definitely come back again!  **special thanks to Julie C. who recommended this hidden gem that's very close to where I live**

Reviews.Author: Dirk
Reviews.Content: Ordered pepper steak  from lunch special thai spicy. Disappointed .....no effort was made to cook it spicy at any level. I could have made the same meal w a Thai cookbook or DVD..Mediocre! Server offered to bring sauces to the rescue the meal but Thai is best cooked w spices. Service is their strength!

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE SERVICE!  The only reason I decided to eat here was because I received a special coupon from Restaurant.com -- it was not a coupon I purchased but a promotion Walgreens was running and I got a $25.00 gift certificate. During my lunch break, I met my boyfriend here and immediately saw an unprofessional sign which said they are no longer accepting the Restaurant.com coupon. I was instantly disappointed and I spoke to the waittress and said I had no idea it was no longer accepted and no where on the certificate does it say management may refuse to accept. Her manager cut in and told me she was no longer accepting the coupon. I said I didn't realize that but is there anything you can honor? She replied in a snooty attitude that she can't accept the coupon and it is not her fault and I can receive my money back from Restaurant.com. I told her I didn't purchase the coupon and so there's no money to be redeemed except for at this restaurant. I asked for her manager and she said the owner was not working today and I asked for his card so I can email him and she said she wasn't allowed to give out his contact information. I asked when he would be in so I can ask him about the coupon and she said he doesn't come in everyday and she has no idea when he'll be here. Throughout the whole time she was be very rude and pointing in my face and I told her that because of her lack of resourcefulness and inability to be polite, I could not eat here so she right away told me she can give me a coupon for $15 and I decided to take it and order some food. However, the coupon was $15 off a purchase of $50 and my boyfriend and I could not order enough food to equal $50. The food was good but I have had better thai food with definitely better service. I will not be returning here.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: We have ordered food here about 20 times. We usually have it delivered and had had nothing but great experiences. The food is SO good, arrives steaming hot and delicious. This is our go to Thai restaurant. I LOVE their curries. I've had masaman, yellow, red, pineapple with chicken and tofu with added vegetables. We always get the crab wontons too. My husband gets noodle or soup. Always delicious!

Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Lunch specials are priced right, however, the meat dishes tend to be overcooked, hard and dry. Will not be returning.

Reviews.Author: Duane
Reviews.Content: Nice little shop, decent decor and ambiance. Yellow curry was creamy and tasty, one of the few places I have been too where you get more chicken than potatoes. Rib soup is tangy and tasty. Basil chicken is decent, pad Thai a little on the sweet side but still palatable. Giant glass of Thai ice tea. We will be back.

Reviews.Author: Glenn
Reviews.Content: Really great Thai food. High quality ingredients.

Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: Tried this place out for dinner tonight thanks to a restaurant.com gift certificate.   Restaurant was clean and spacious. I'm used to the  hole in the wall  settings. This one has a nice laid back interior.   We ordered shrimp pad thai, sweet chili basil with chicken, and crab fried rice. Portion of pad thai was a bit small but the size of shrimp was rather big. Spicy chili basil with chicken was good, but didn't taste anything out of the ordinary.  Same with crab fried rice.  This order was huge.  The latter 2 orders we took home to go since both portions were more than enough for 2 people.  I would come back to this place if I were in the area, but I think I still prefer my usual go-to Thai place Noodle House.

Reviews.Author: Lynn
Reviews.Content: Just ate a paper towel that was in my soup! I thought it was cabbage. I just walked out without paying of course. The waitress chased me down to apologize, but I will never eat here again!

Reviews.Author: Grace
Reviews.Content: This is my third order for Panna Thai delivery, and every single time they have forgotten the cucumbers and pineapples for my simple Thai Salad. I don't understand - its clearly in the description. I don't just want lettuce, tomato and grilled chicken next time (If there is a next time at this point....)   :(  They are not knowledgable, but they are very friendly and the grilled chicken tastes good.

Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: Great food, great prices. Everytime I order delivery always on time and accurate with my order. Food shows up hot and delicious. Panna is always my first choice for thai food. The Panang Curry is my favorite dish, if you get this get the combination you will love it. Wonton soup is some of the best soup I have ever had.  I always recommend Panna Thai over other restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: We went for dinner a few weeks ago using a City Coups coupon for 1/2 off entree with purchase of an entree.    We ordered the  Pumpkin Shrimp Curry and the Mushroom and Broccoli with Pork. The shrimp had the tails on in the curry.  The broccoli was crisp and cooked perfectly.  The brown sauce was flavorful.  I would order both entrees again.  We will be back.

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: The fried rice was nothing special. The vegetable garden is sloppy like they just used the left over vegetables from every other dish and the crab wontons were the worse disappointment. The fried shell was soggy and the filling didn't have that wonderful cream cheese flavor they usually have. I don't think I can even give this place another chance. Such an unsatisfactory meal.

Reviews.Author: Nadia
Reviews.Content: Great Customer Service. Fast. Inexpensive. Delicious. Clean. Did I mention the customer service!

Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: Excellent food and service. Wish I knew about this place sooner. Started with the egg rolls then ordered the pork BBQ noodle soup. So delicious and a huge portion That I had enough to take home and have for lunch the next day.

Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: We visited Panna last night.  I was a little aprrehensive since the online coupons have brought us to pretty run down places.  The moment we walked into Panna, I was pleased.  The lighting was dining room  perfect, the colors and decor were chic and welcoming, no typical greasy smell associated with asian restaurants.  The food was very impressive too.  good quality and fresh seafood and veggies and flavorful ingredience...and very appetizing but not too over the top presentation. We ordered the saute shrimp and egglant dish that came on a sizzling plate.  all veggies and seafoods cooked to perfection.  the basil & garlic dish with pork was excellent.  Kids got Chicken Satay, Angel wings, steamed dumpling, Pad Thai and  Pad na...all were good.  Maybe only the steamed dumplings lost a little steam.  Service was impeccable.  We are bringing our employees back to the restaurant again...tonight!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: Nice, light, well done Thai food. The beef satay and veggie pad thai were deliciousssss, non-greasy, and well-priced. The service was awkward - the girl spoke English but she had trouble with our order (there was lots of staring and awkward pauses) and we ended up with someone else's order on our table. The mix-up was fixed quickly and everyone was very nice.  I'll be back to try more of their dishes.

Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: BEST Thai place. I frequent here or order to go quite often. Everything is always delicious and great service! The bbq spare ribs are the best I've had! I also love their delightful noodle, yellow curry, Tom Kai, and the golden cup appetizer! Also, they do free refills on Thai tea (that's a winner for me & keeps me always coming back!) and delicious sweet rice all year round! Always love the friendliness here and how fast they are!

Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: After a long weekend in Vegas, we ordered take out from here and brought it to my friend's house.  The BBQ ribs were perfectly seasoned and tender. The wonton soup we had was chalk full of veggies.  Our only knock was the calamari - by the time we got home - wasn't crispy anymore.  Otherwise, it was fast, tasty and we will visit again.

Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: I've been to many thai restaurants in Vegas, but this one is my favorite. Why? Because they have the best sticky rice and pork jerky! I can't get enough of that stuff. Reminds me of eating on the streets of Thailand. They also have a great beef sate, its hard to find good sate, a lot of times you'll end up with a rough, dried piece of meat on a stick but not here, its tender and delicious! But if you're in the mood for something simple, try the pad see-ew, really good, the noodles are cooked so perfectly. I love it when I eat pad see-ew and there's that frangrant smell of the stir-fried noodles, can't really explain it, but it smells soooo good!

Reviews.Author: F
Reviews.Content: Value of lunch special was decent--for 6.95 you get your choice of meat, a soup and a small fried won ton.  We had garlic short rib and chicken satay special.  Satay was good, garlic sb ok sauce was a little too strong/salty.  We also ordered pork larb which was good...don't order fried egg rolls as these were frozen and not hand made...I wish I didn't order it.  Restaurant was hot...and there wasn't anyone else as far as patrons.  Service was good and restaurant was clean.  I'd go again but only if in the area...one good thing is lunch ends at 4 where as most places it is 3.  One bad they charge for more rice at 1.50 per bowl.

Reviews.Author: Kristan
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with their spice level at all. I got a 5 for extra spicy and it was nearly even a kick. The Pad Thai was soggy and not good flavor sadly. The chicken salad was great along with the Chai Tea. I was hoping to have another fave Thai place but I'll be sticking to my #1 fave.

Reviews.Author: Rose
Reviews.Content: This place always forget one item but they return in less than 15 min and with an extra something. So I love them and they still get 5 stars. We always get the sticky rice and beef jerky! Delicious!

Reviews.Author: Shue
Reviews.Content: The food is decent, but with the handful of times I've been there...worst customer service, EVER.

Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: I've been to a few Thai restaurants in Vegas (yeah even Lotus of Siam... Which has great food but the ambiance of a bus depot)... This is hands down our favorite Thai restaurant.  Nice ambiance, great pricing, and the dishes are amazing. I usually stick to the Crab Wantons and Pad Thai but they have a new tapas menu that is insane. Everything we tried was a winner.   Hidden Thai jewel in the southwest. I promise you.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay
Reviews.Content: the best thai food in vegas hands down!!! their pineapple fried rice is to die for!!

Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: Awesome food. The ckn larb gia was fantastic. Nice and spicy. Full of flavor. It came out quick and hot.  The Thai tea was delicious.  The chicken pad thai was a little dry. Their jasmine rice is very fresh. Great atmosphere for a business meeting or an intimate dinner.  Would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: Great lunch menu, everything was reasonably price and well prepared. My wife loves the wonton soup and summer rolls for carry out.

Reviews.Author: Brittney
Reviews.Content: Someone referred this place to me while I was in Vegas this trip so I had to try it. I was not disappointed! It was so good and so fresh! I had the ahi tuna salad (good amount of tuna, good amount of dressing, good to split between 4 people if you plan on sharing all your food selections) and sa te meal with beef (perfect flavor and perfectly tender, peanut sauce was perfect, egg fried rice was tasty). Other people in my party ordered the fish cake and red chicken curry. Didn't try the fish cake but they said it was good and I wasn't too fond of the curry personally but it may be be caused I'm biased towards the homemade one my grandma makes. Anyway, this place is must try for Thai food in Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: Outline: Very slow service, iffy food.  Ok, I gave it 4 tries. This time it really did it.   I would give three stars for food. Here is why: I don't think it's anything great, but it's not too bad either. Although yesterday my husband refused to finish any of the dishes and my 3 year old is literally throwing up as I write this. Last night he had fried rice and soup (she hadn't eaten anything else for dinner - very slim chance of a coincidence).  All four times I've been there, it takes 40 minutes to an hour + to get done. And we are usually  fast  eaters. We sit down, we know what we want, we eat, and we're out. We go out every day and don't have time to sit around and talk like some people do.  Ok, I can understand that also, but when it takes 10 minutes between asking for a check and actually getting one there is something wrong here. My husband had already left by then as my 3 year old had enough of sitting there that long. Good thing I paid with cash or I wouldn't be able to wait for another 10 minutes for them to run a card.  As much as I want to like it, I can't, and I won't be going back.

Reviews.Author: Kari
Reviews.Content: Ive only ordered delivery from this restaurant, never actually been inside... but twice now I've been very impressed!  Food is delicious!  And even the take out has good presentation. Portions are reasonable... not huge shareable size like many places. Some people may not like that. But I thought it was perfect. Warning... I ordered Spicy on my pad thai and it was REALLY spicy!  Lol. But I like things hot. The tuna taretare was really light with a unique tangy flavor that I loved. And the roasted vegetables were delicious, also served with a yummy tangy dressing. Will be ordering from here a lot!

Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed this place the two times before we went awhile back but recently had a horrible expierence.  Not sure if they hired new folks but they were just rude.  My family and I a total of 6 of us with two little ones went in and the service was super poor.  There was only 2 other people in the restaurant.   When we went to order we just asked to have a chicken breast for my daughter and they said no whole meal...they were so focused on serviing whole plates they couldn't accomadate.  I even told them to charge us the full price but just a chicken breast is what I needed but they said no that they couldn't do it.  We asked for a side of broccoli and carrots and they said no.  It was ridiculous.  At that point I didn't care if they charged me $20 bucks for broccoli that is what we needed but they couldn't do it.  Finally my husband went to talk to the gentleman behind the counter and asked for the manager and he was very rude and said no manager here and there was nothing he could do.  My husband said we would leave so we all got up and went next door to the sushi place where they always treat us great.    The gentleman tried to make excuses saying it wasn't his fault and he didn't serve us and he was busy with the two other people in the restaurant.  They still charged us for food they never brought us and we were so frustrated that we gave them the money and left.  We will never go back ever and I would suggest if you want a stressfree meal not to go as well.

Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: I went here tonight for the first time because I had a restaurant.com certificate and was feeling like the comfort food goodness that is Thai cuisine.  When I walked in, the atmosphere was pleasant and quiet and the server was friendly.  I ordered the egg rolls, the tom yum goong, the pad see ew, and the red curry.  Everything was really tasty.  While it wasn't THE best Thai food I've ever had, it was easily one of the best places I've been to outside of China Town (though this place is sort of on the cusp).  My only (minor) complaint is that they didn't have the type of egg rolls I liked.  Definitely worth visiting if you're in the area.

Reviews.Author: Manish
Reviews.Content: The food was ok. Got vegetable spring rolls, fried tofu, pineapple fried rice. It was nothing to write home about.   Ambience was nice enough and clean. The bathroom was a little dirty and you could tell it needed to be cleaned.   Where they really lost the stars was service. There was only three other parties in the joint and yet it felt like our servers were nowhere to be seen. I had some trouble understanding the waiter through his thick accent. They were very nice and friendly but I had to wait a while to have t water refilled and never got a refill on my ice tea.  I'm sure there are better Thai restaurants out here in the valley.

Reviews.Author: Celine
Reviews.Content: Great close thai place close to home. And they deliver! Can't wait to try again so i can try the papaya fries!

Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: Love their calamari! Tender in, crispy out. Not overcooled like many others I've had.  I love the pad see ew, and pad Thai. I try getting new things but I always find myself returning to the see ew

Reviews.Author: Hazel
Reviews.Content: Their dishes are delicious and they give you a good amount of serving. They give you refills on Thai Tea as well.  Panna Thai also have a great crew.

Reviews.Author: Adrian
Reviews.Content: I find reviews on ethnic restaurants extremely tough to judge.  It seems as though most of the  casual  eaters rate the food at these establishments pretty high, while those with a tongue for Thai are a little more honest.  I'd like to think of myself as the latter.  My friends and I were greeted warmly and seated promptly as soon as we entered Panna Thai.  The earth-toned interior was decorated nicely with Thai accents as jazz music filled our ears and provided a relaxing atmosphere for good conversation.  Arriving about an hour before closing time, all servers still did their best to be friendly and attentive.    We shared Tom Yum Soup, choosing to go with the highest spicy level.  The large size was perfect for three or four people to share.  Medium level spicy had just the right amount of bite without being too overwhelming, and we were already sweating after a few minutes -- the mark of good tom yum.  Sinuses were cleared in no time.  It didn't matter that we never got the extra napkins we requested; we were too busy enjoying the great flavor and awesome start to the meal.  Next came the Spicy Crab Noodle and Spicy Fish Cha Cha.  I usually like to try the spicy fish dishes in every Thai restaurant I visit, so the Spicy Fish Cha Cha was a logical choice.  Choosing  spicy  on the mild-medium-spicy scale for both dishes did not disappoint, as the extra kick only enhanced the tremendous flavor.  The portions were fairly generous, and the remaining fish survived our appetites and made it to the take-home box .  The noodles were not so lucky.  Any time I end up overeating to the point of near-food coma, the food is just that damn good.  Panna Thai, we shall meet again soon.

Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: Picked up food to go for an evening in.  When I arrived, the food was ready and warm.  The Yellow Curry is by far the best I've had in Las Vegas.  The beef Sa-te is also delicious.  I'll have to come back to try out their other dishes and service!

Reviews.Author: Heinrich
Reviews.Content: Very nice customer service and delicious food. I wont tell why but you have to come and try it and youll see what im talking about! Trust me it is the best thai restaurant i have ever eaten!

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: Everything was great! We ordered grilled chicken skewers YUMMY, BBQ beef salad BOMB, Tom yum soup Spicy sour and good! Pad Thai with shrimp, spicy eggplant wasn't too spicy it was ok!  Def will be our new Thai spot since it's close to home!

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: Finally tried somewhere different than the usual few restaurants I usually go to in Summerlin. Driving way out to the southwest to try a new restaurant was a big adventure for me :)  Boy, was it worth it.  I go to Archi's very frequently, and I still love that place, but the Tom-Yum soup at Panna Thai was mind blowing.  This is the first time I've ever used that expression, BTW-- mind blowing.   Also loved the vegetable egg rolls and pad thai w/ tofu.  Service was top-notch.  Interior of restaurant was lovely.  I already can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Delivery took over 45 minutes but the online ordering was pretty easy and painless.  Beef Salad was the best item in my order.  As another reviewer mentioned, the beef was nicely smokey, and it was okay quality meat, not gristly.  The salad is mostly meat, with light lettuce and some tomatoes and cucumbers.  The dressing is mostly lime juice, which I like.  A good low calorie fairly-healthy choice.  I would have liked cucumber slices that were a bit larger.  Chicken Fried Rice was kind of weird, there were clumps that were really sweet (maybe it was sweetened eggs?), but mostly it was really bizarrely bland.  Tons of onions.  Not much chicken or tomatoes.  I would not get this again, myself.  Green Milk Boba was overpriced, the cup was small styrofoam (12-16oz if there wasn't any ice), 50% ice at least, and barely any boba ($1 upcharge).  The boba were super overcooked to the point they had melted down small.  For $4.50 I could have a monster-size boba somewhere else.  This place is not cheap, but still one of the better delivery options in this neighborhood.  Maybe I'll enjoy some of their other dishes more.

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: It's not the best Thai I've ever had but it is fantastic for the price. I love when places like this have pictures of almost every dish in the menu so you can see what you're ordering even if you don't know how to pronounce it. The crab Rangoon is a great app shared among friends. I've tried a few of the interesting soups and the Chicken Pad Thai.  The staff is always friendly though their English isn't the best. I haven't taken advantage of their delivery services yet but it's nice to know they deliver since they're only a couple of minutes from my house.

Reviews.Author: Our
Reviews.Content: Mongolian Beef is where it's at. Best Thai food we have ever had. Probably the only restaurant we will ever rate 5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Lola
Reviews.Content: This is my absolute favorite place to go every Sunday. People will ask me what Im doing for lunch and my response,  I've got a date with Panna.  Seriously though, customer service is absolutely great. Last time I was there, the lady had forgotten I had said no onions and was utterly apologetic for it, which was unnecessary as accidents do happen, but then proceeded to extend the hospitality by bringing out a dessert as an apology. I mean, even though it was unnecessary and very generous, you just dont get customer service like that anymore.  Oh and fellas, this little restaurant is hiding some of the most beautiful women I have seen in the desert to date.    Enjoy, XO

Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: The good... This is the best Thai food in Vegas, period. Price. Decor.  The bad... They should cover\hide the storage area so customers don't see it.  I don't give 5 star ratings unless the food is really excellent.

Reviews.Author: tracy
Reviews.Content: If you're in the mood for good thai food, stop by. They  have a great Tom Yum Chicken soup, and my daughter loves the skewers. My favorite is the beef salad xtra spicy. The staff is VERY friendly and you get served rather quickly. They even deliver if you do not feel like going out.. This is our favorite place after soccer practice. I highly encourage you to give em a try

Reviews.Author: Tricia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have ordered from here several times and there has NEVER been a issue. The food is excellent and fresh and the delivery service is prompt. We ordered the combo satay, spring rolls and pad thai. Everything was fresh, packaged nicely and delicious. I must recommend the spring rolls especially because of just how well made they were. The satay came with rice and the best peanut sauce I've ever eaten. There literally isn't one negative thing i can say. I highly recommend Panna Thai!

Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: We got recommended by a friend so we gave it a shot  It is a bit further from Vegas Strips but it's worth driving and try. The interior is clean and chic. Service is warm welcome. Price is reasonable compared to the portion and the quality of food. Most importantly the taste is very good and considered authentic. I love the Beef sa-te, Spicy Crab noodle, fried banana. We definitely will go back and try more dishes. Sooooo yummy!!!

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Best Thai food around the southwest area. The satay beef or chicken is to died for. Also, larb with sticky rice is my all time fav.

Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: Food was bomb! Got the pad thai with chicken and panang curry! Free thai coffee and thai tea refills!

Reviews.Author: Neil
Reviews.Content: Good thai food and the service was very good and quick. We tried the lumch specials which seemed to range from $6 to $10 and came with the daily soup and eggroll. Also we tried the golden cups as an appetizer and they were amazing! If your in the mood for Thai food this would be a good place to try.

Reviews.Author: Yuqi
Reviews.Content: Food is okay and everything takes forever. Appetizer took 20 mins to get here. If you have enough patience then it won't bother you that much. Just asked for my check 5 mins ago as we speak. Everybody works here is like in slow motion.

Reviews.Author: Poco
Reviews.Content: Every single time I have eaten here, I have only ordered the Beef Salad & the Monster (Shrimp Salad) every time!  I'm addicted to the sauce & the vegetables in the salad are fresh!  The fried tofu is the only appetizer I get cause it to comes w/ an amazing & addicting sauce.    One day I may or may not ever try something new cause for me, it's just that type of restaurant.  I love these two salads... strange, but a must-try!  Especially if you want to eat alil healthy.!

Reviews.Author: Nevada
Reviews.Content: Amazing Thai food and a great atmosphere!  Family owned and operated! The staff is very friendly and the restaurant is clean.

Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Panna Thai is a cozy restaurant in the corner of a strip mall. The decor and ambiance of the restaurant is above average for a restaurant of this size and popularity.  The wait staff was fairly attentive and friendly.  I had the beef salad, which they do a little differently than most Thai places... the beef is done barbeque style, so it has a smokey flavor. Overall I prefer the more traditional pan-seared marinaded steak for this dish.

Reviews.Author: Stefany
Reviews.Content: The BF regularly orders from here when he's at work. I get leftovers when he overorders- which isn't all that often, actually. The thai jerky and the crab fried rice are consistently good options, but I especially like combining the two. The dipping sauce for the jerky is awesome! They do have a $20 minimum for delivery.

Reviews.Author: Cassandra
Reviews.Content: Food is delicious here. Been coming for years, only downside is you can tell that sometimes the proteins or coconuts have gotten a little old. Not bad, but not really fresh either. We were here New Year's Eve and we waited almost a full hour for one of our dishes, they must've forgot with all the takeout going out the door. Always really nice people though.

Reviews.Author: Audrene
Reviews.Content: First of all, after waiting almost 20 minutes, I had to leave my table to ask for a glass of water. I ordered crab fried rice with no egg extra garlic. I also explained, I have a allergy to egg. When the plate arrived, it had lots of egg. I explained to Ann, the order was incorrect. Ann was so unbelievably rude. She tried to convince me that the egg needed to be in the plate even after I explained for the second time, I have an allergy to egg. Even after correcting my order, I waited  20 minutes after I was done eating for  the check  to arrive to my table.  Not once did they come by to pick up my plates so I just put it in the table next to me. Jump is the name of another employee there and honestly he was very professional and apologized then tried to encourage  me to come back. Unfortunately, first time impressions last forever and I will never come back.   Becomes of the nice guy named Jump I  gave a two star instead of one.

Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I've tried many Thai places in Las Vegas, this one is hands down the best.

Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: Great neighborhood Thai restaurant. Perfect for pick up or delivery. Dine in is ok ... wait staff is always friendly and we're never left waiting. Excellent coconut soup!!

Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: The food is delicious! Restaurant is clean. They have great dish presentations. The staff is welcoming and friendly. Their prices are reasonable as well. We have dined here twice and enjoyed it both occasions. Definitely a place to check out!

Reviews.Author: Mackenzie
Reviews.Content: The food was 5 stars all the way! Tuna tartar appetizer is a must....egg rolls and dumplings are great too! Service was extra slow! There were only two young ladies working the dining room doing everything...I felt bad for them but this made our experience slow and long. We will eat here again....I think we will just order take out and enjoy at home!

Reviews.Author: Danika
Reviews.Content: Great food great service!  Love the beef panang! So yummy!  Thai ice tea is very tasty too!  Will definitely be coming back

Reviews.Author: Dominique
Reviews.Content: I came here for dinner with some friends and... I totally love this place! The ambiance has more of a business casual vibe... Could be great for a date night... Or a business lunch :)    The servers were all very sweet and on top of the table. They made great suggestions for food and beverages. Our waters were always full and I never had to ask for another glass of wine :) (They only offer beer and wine).   They offer a large menu with lots of different veggie dishes! I was really excited about that! I ordered a red curry with lots of veggies! The spice level ranges from mild to extra spicy. I ordered spicy and could of definitely used more heat... So if you like hot... Make sure you are very specific. My friend ordered a yellow medium beef curry and loved it!! My other friends orders BBQ chicken with veggies and fried rice. Both said the chicken was really really good.   Dessert consisted of a chocolate lava cake with ice cream and fried coconut bananas with ice cream, neither of which I could eat... But the lava cake got some raving reviews!!   They have some really amazing lunches specials that I plan on checking out. I am really excited to go back!

Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: I dream about their Pad Woon Sen, that is their silver noodle dish with shrimp, pork, vermicelli, veges and sauce. Let me tell you about the sauce, it's a great balance of sweet, salty, sour and spicy which are the basis for most Thai dishes.   Their tea is also really good quality Jasmine tea bags. I liked it so much, I took a picture so I can look for the brand and but it for home.   Service is good because they kept filling out water and removed our dishes when needed.

Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere  Great food Very reasonable pricing  I promise you will be impressed by this Thai restaurant

Reviews.Author: Link
Reviews.Content: The Yellow Curry that i ordered was AMAZING, very flavorful and just spicy enough to keep every bite interesting.  My only complaint is the amount of rice given... they only give 1 bowl of rice per order, and that is not nearly enough for an avid rice fan like me... (it also costs $1.50 for another small bowl)  Also tried the Fried Banana as  the dessert and the presentation was ELEGANT, the fried banana was coated in coconut and it tasted GOOD with the lemony type sauce it came with.  Great food and the price is definitely do-able.  Would go back there again simply for their Curry.

Reviews.Author: Bradford
Reviews.Content: This restaurant continues to deliver excellence. Tried almost every Thai place in the valley; this is the best. Warm service, pretty restaurant that maintains a pleasant, calm atmosphere. Great place for couples. Very clean. Food is really good and reasonably priced. Pad Thai, green curry, basil beef, chicken salad, Tom Kha soup, fried bananas for dessert, all top notch and cannot be beaten in Las Vegas. Servers are friendly and caring, chefs are inspired, owner really dedicated to her business. If you miss this, you will miss out on the best. It is our only destination for Thai in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Panna Thai is just up the road from my office and is a convenient lunch spot.   The food here is good - very good - and the service is always friendly.   I'm not an overly adventurous eater of Thai food, so I stick with pad thai, pad see ew or curry dishes.   All of those dishes are well made and flavorful at Panna Thai.   The wait time for food can be a little longer than I would expect at times, depending on busy they are, but nothing too terrible.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Tom Kha soup was delicious!!!  Nice ambiance and decor; however, the music was a bit too loud. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Author: Dj
Reviews.Content: We have been eating here for years and it's consistently good. The service can be slow during busy hours but the ambiance makes it tolerable. We love the Prig King, Red Curry with fried tofu and the vegan spring roll appetizer is great. Servers are always super nice and they deliver too! Bathrooms are always spotless which we live. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Tamster
Reviews.Content: I tried the Pumpkin Curry Shrimp.   Loved It!   Best Thai Restaurant I have been to with excellent service, great atmosphere, great prices and absolutely delicious food.  Pad Thai was awesome too.   Going back again.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I love the chicken curry here. The fried rice is really good too. The place is really nice inside.

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: Ordered from here and was told it would be to my home within 45 mins...  An hour and a half later I got a call from the restaurant asking if they had the correct address, I informed them of the correct address and was told they would be to my home ASAP... 30 mins later I called the restaurant and was told a lie that they didn't know what to do with the food and was to a huge lie by not only the manager but the original driver who contacted me.  I am so disappointed and will not order from them again nor will I recommend them at all.  They offered me a 5 dollar discount for my next order... Laughable since this order was almost 60.  Time to move on

Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: Wow!! Ordered delivery. They arrived right on time! Ahi tuna salad was amazing. Crab fried rice was tasty!! Curry chicken fettuccine was genius!! Ive been to plenty of thai restaurants and i was impressed!!

Reviews.Author: Julie M
Reviews.Content: Very clean place and food is delicious the only thing to work on would be service because it is pretty slow but I will go back for more

Reviews.Author: Qurat
Reviews.Content: I'm not the type to review based on service...   Basil Noodles: super fresh vegetables in the mix and they allow you to pick the kind of noodle (thick or thin) you want   Pad See Ew: perfect balance of sauce, broccoli and chicken. They allow you to pick between regular and Chinese broccoli   They have the option to make anything spicy which I loved.   Service: friendly and attentive- confused me order with someone else's twice... But food was so good it doesn't affect the rating.

Reviews.Author: Candace
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for my anniversary and decided to try this place. Overall, I had a great experience here. The food was awesome! I was on a mission to find the best Thai Beef Salad and I think I found it here! The service was phenomenal.   If you ever go to Las Vegas and want to dine away from Strip, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Author: Noel
Reviews.Content: This place is great! I have food allergies but love eating out. They always take care of me and keep the  can't haves  away from my food. I love their chicken pad Thai! If I had the money I would eat here everyday! The best part about this place is the fast delivery and you can order online/in app. That's right, I love this place so much I downloaded their app! Lol. We dine in every now and then but with a new baby delivery is just better if the baby is fussy. Great place with great staff. Would (and do) recommend to friends.

Reviews.Author: Jaymee
Reviews.Content: Thai food is just delicious but Panna Thai makes it irresistible.   Food is scrumptious with good portions.   Ambiance is very private, mellow yet warm & friendly.   Prices are very reasonable (almost like Thai BBQ).  Overall ~ will be coming back for more!

Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: I love me some Thai and this strip mall wonder is a thunder from down under, spicey as you want it, with a nice kick.   We had the beef jerky appetizer and it was perfectly done.   We also had a duck soup, mmmmm...so good, and the wifey had drunken noodles, she loves getting drunken and having noodles too...lol.   Really, this place is pretty hot.  Not 5 star for vegas, but a solid date night no less.   Off the beaten path, so quite quite for the romantic evening.  Staff as stellar on service!

Reviews.Author: Wil
Reviews.Content: Have dined in most of the Thai restaurants in Vegas and Panna stands out above the rest. Service is phenomenal, and the decor is extremely modern and well done. Now, I know some people enjoy the coconut type Thai food with the sweet tea, etc. etc, but I prefer the Tough Love from my Thai. Panna makes truly hot, spicy food that can easily bring a grown man to tears. I'm sweating a bit right now just thinking about it. So, if you like authentic hot spicy Thai food, Panna is definitely the way to go.

Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: Great food. Good atmosphere.   I got the yellow curry with chicken and it was great. Lots of chicken.

Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: I really love this place.  I think the food is better than any of my other Thai food places...problem is it is far from me...probably a good thing because I would go there all of the time!  I think there dishes are very well done, tasty and to the point.  Servers are all very gracious and conscientious.  A nice place to go when you have a craving for Thai food!

Reviews.Author: Ros
Reviews.Content: Got to try this spot out over the weekend, and I am bewildered WHY we didn't try it sooner!  We have been going to Benjaroong since it was so close to our house.  However after trying Panna Thai we have officially met satisfaction.  Not only are the prices great, but the flavors were amazing and FRESH!

Reviews.Author: Pauline
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the weekend and got invited to a birthday celebration there. There were about 20 of us and yet the service was excellent! We ordered a plethora of appetizers and dishes as well as various drinks and honestly nothing was left out.  What was really shocking was that they gave out free refills for the Thai iced teas! We asked if this was complimentary but they informed us that they usually only do it for regular customers like us. Talk about getting on their good side!  Overall this was a great place to go for both food and service, the restaurant itself was very clean and tidy and even had a flat screen tv so we could watch the NBA finals. How did we end the night? Fried coconut covered bananas. YUM :D

Reviews.Author: Camille
Reviews.Content: I am not very adventerous with my Thai choices, and like mine Americanized, so no complaints there.  Beef Sa-Tay = So good.  Sweet, tender, with crispy grill marks.  The crispy burned pieces on meat makes me so happy.   Pepper Beef = Tender and a mild spice. My boyfriend likes this dish, but I am not fan of red/green peppers, so I just sneak a bite or two of just the meat. Pad Thai = Sweeter than other places, but always tasty. Pineapple Fried Rice = Comes with both Shrimp and Chicken which I like. I often ask for it to have a bit extra spice, but I think I like it better original.  There was a two large parties in there tonight, so the staff was busy with them - but we didn't feel abandoned.  I do have to say the ribs the table next to me ordered, looked delicious and might be the next thing I order!

Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: We had a restaurant.com gift certificate that needed using, so we headed down there.  When we walked in the door we were greeted with smiles and shown to our table in a very nicely decorated restaurant with good atmosphere.  To start with, we both had Thai iced teas that were fantastic and refilled before they were halfway empty. We shared a bowl of Tom Kha Gha, which was the best I've ever had.  For entrees, we had the Red Curry with Chicken and Sweety Duck, both of which were fantastic.  The duck was moist with a nice crispy skin and honey glaze, served with steamed broccoli.  The curry had a generous amount of meat and the veggies were fresh and not overcooked.    Dessert was the house specialty: Mango with Sticky Rice.  Excellent, though it's seasonal, subject to ripe mangos, so take advantage in the springtime! Homemade Coconut Ice Cream is also on the menu, though we didn't get to try it because we were stuffed.  As mentioned in other reviews, the portion size is generous.  Neither my wife nor I were able to finish our entrees and it was packed up with extra rice to take home.  Excellent, friendly service, good quality food at a reasonable price in a nice environment.  Adds up to 5 stars to me!  Oh, and they deliver.

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I don't review much, but since we eat here a lot and we're crazy about their Crispy Soft Shell Crab, the Seared Scallops, Yum Tuna, Minced Chicken & Shrimp with Curry and Crispy Duck Salad, (among other dishes), I felt it was time to say something nice. The dishes are original and super delicious, with no added MSG, and the service is exceptional. Every meal we've had has been off the charts good.  My wife and I used to eat at a lot of different Thai restaurants, in search for the best in town. And although it's a bit of a drive for me and there are dozens of other Thai restaurants closer to home (some pretty good), we can't eat anywhere else anymore.

Reviews.Author: A.
Reviews.Content: Went here after a friend recommended it and we loved it.  Took a restaurant.com certificate, which really saved some cash as well.  We were 3 of us, and ordered chicken satay and 4 entrees, and with tip the bill was $29.  The portions are larger than most other That restaurants in town, and the food was generally as good as Pin Kaow.  The chicken satay was excellent.  The pineapple curry was very good, as it had strips of shredded chicken, and a nice spicy bite to it.  The pad se ew was good, although to be honest, I think Pin Kaows is better.  That being said, it was still good.  We also had a glass noodle dish called Beautiful Noodle, or something like that, which my wife really enjoyed.  Overall, the service was good and friendly, the food was very good, and the price was phenomenal.  I will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Author: Deanna
Reviews.Content: Had a great meal, bang bang shrimp was our fav. Date night ended with fried bananas and coconut sticky rice ice cream. Yum!

Reviews.Author: Or
Reviews.Content: Got the tofu pad Thai, good and fast service the food was good not something extra ordinary but tasty I asked for spicy but in my standards it wasn't really spicy, I will come back to check the lunch time special next visit

Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: Another great meal at our fav thai restaurant.  Had the mango chicken this time an it was awesome. It comes witj white rice an the flavor is great. Its sweet an just enough batter on the chicken is perfect. Great portions as well. They never disappoint.  Great food an great service.  Also had my favorites crab wanton an egg rolls. Thank for another great meal.

Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: We've eaten here 3 times now, trying different items, and every meal has been wonderful. Friendly staff, comfortable decor, great service... Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: It's a nice place to get Thai food! Usually delicious without a doubt but the service sometimes is hit or miss. I've had dining occasions where everything came out perfectly timed and had a flawless experience. I've also had experienced where the boyfriends entree came out before the appetizer. Then his pre dinner soup 5 min later then the appetizer 5 min later. THEN 10 min later MY entree showed up and my boyfriend was already done eating. They gave a 10% discount off the whole bill which was a nice recovery. She was also extremely apologetic which helped. Hopefully she learns from this mistake because this is a huge no no in food and bev.

Reviews.Author: Junnel
Reviews.Content: The best MANGO CHICKEN!!! Very authentic and fresh thai food!! Everytime we order an entree we notice that they're not stingy when it comes to putting any meats & main dishes unlike other restaurants. Great service & a must try JASMINE GREAT TEA to wash off the whole meal.

Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: Good food, good ambience, and fabulous service for a good price. We got panang curry (delicious), Thai steak (okay, a little salty), and sticky rice with mangoes (super cute and tasty). The serving size is big, so I think we would have been fine with just the curry. Looking forward to bringing guests here. I definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: Awesome service and food. The chicken at this place is good quality, white breast meat. RAD !

Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why I never tried Panna Thai until now but I'm glad I did. It was a rainy week this week in Vegas and after cooking something at home and it not turning out just right I called Panna.   I ordered the crab wontons and pork pad see ew. I have been on a pork kick lately so that was the reason instead of going traditional with the beef. I was really eager to try the crab wontons as I saw that it was made with real crab. Sure enough it was as delish as other Yelpers had said it was and I even told my husband he HAD to try it. The consensus in our household was that it was pretty great. The pork pad see ew was good but I'm a carbs person. The pork to noodle ratio was about 2:1 so I felt like I was eating a lot of meat. Overall the flavor was good I just didn't like the overbearing meat but if you are a meat eater than this is definitely for you. I have to say I felt like I did get my money's worth in regards to both items.   The next day I wanted to try the BBQ pork noodles. It's BBQ pork noodle soup and I really really really enjoyed the pork. It was tender and there was plenty (which in this case I appreciated). Yes, I know I'm picky but I felt that the pork to egg noodle ratio was just perfect. I also ordered the spicy basil pork. Now that dish was just ok...definitely not my favorite place to order it from as I missed the cucumbers that do come with it at other Thai places. Overall, I def enjoyed this place. They do get busy though because the second night even though we ordered it at 7:30 pm it still was a 20-30 minute pick up time. They deliver too if you really need some Thai food.

Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: Panna Thai has a really delicious menu, although we usually end up ordering the same things. Two of the best items are the seared ahi tuna and eggplant/shrimp. The service is good and we never have to wait long. The ambiance is also very modern and pleasant. So why only 2 stars? Unfortunately, last time that we ate here, my girlfriend paid for the bill with her credit card and left a generous cash tip. The staff then decided to take an additional tip from her credit card. This is straight-up theft. Unauthorized charges on an individual's credit card is a crime. Furthermore, it shows that the staff is not communicating. We still may go back for the food, but we will definitely be paying our entire bill in cash.

Reviews.Author: Brittany
Reviews.Content: Found this place through a buddy of mine..decided I would try it out and ordered delivery that took 2.5 hours to get my food..by the time the food reached my door it was cold and I had no interest in eating it..if you're lookin for Thai food go with Basil and Lime. They are much better and tend to take their job seriously as well as care about the consumer.

Reviews.Author: B
Reviews.Content: Surprised this place has 4 stars! The food wasn't terrible but being next door to such amazing Thai places that set the bar so high (Surangs & Corner Thai), you've got a lot to live up to. We got   Pork Pad Thai- spice level 4 no complaints here, was good !  Papaya salad - spice level 4 but papaya was really soggy with the sauce and wasn't sliced the authentic way, which really changes the texture.  Vietnamese egg rolls - the neon orange sauce was way too sweet, no spice at all. Not home made  Sticky rice - even though it's only a $2 item it's what I look forward to almost the most. This seemed to be really old. The second we took it out of the bag it hardened up and was inedible. ;(

Reviews.Author: Monty
Reviews.Content: Great selection on the menu. The food is consistently good. The staff is always friendly.

Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I'm reviewing solely on their delivery service (and food). I've ordered from here through Eat24 a couple of times and both times they have been on schedule. My recent order included Panang Curry, Steamed Dumplings, and Tasty Ginger (with shrimp).  The curry was delicious. I ordered a mild but it came with a kick. Not sure if they got it wrong, or my tolerance is very low. It was creamy and very coconutty. The chicken was also nice and tender. I didn't really care for the dumplings. They were good, but they had an off taste that I couldn't quite figure out. The dipping sauce that came with the dumplings was a bit too strong in flavor. The tasty ginger with shrimp was my favorite. It had just the right amount of ginger and spices and the shrimp (peeled) was perfectly cooked. Their Thai tea is also very good (pretty generous with the cream, which I like).  If you're ordering through Yelp Eat24, the entrees come with rice. The menu doesn't state that. I wish I knew beforehand because I ordered 2 servings of rice and it came with 4.

Reviews.Author: Guty
Reviews.Content: Good food overall, nothing to write to mom about but maybe I need to give it a 2nd try one day down the road. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Author: Wing
Reviews.Content: Service and speed are the reason why I give this a 2 star. Always a wait with plenty of tables available. Got a to go order. Salmon curry had approximately 8 cubes of salmon about 1/8 inch. Very small box and curry spilled all into salad that was about 5 pieces and egg roll was soggy   Much to be desired for take out.

Reviews.Author: Leah
Reviews.Content: Delish! Coconut soup medium and garlic short ribs at least 1x/week! They are great for take-out and dining in. Always friendly - always good!

Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: I've been here a number of times for both lunch and dinner.  The prices are very reasonable.  The food is good and is a good value.  The service staff is very friendly and I have found this a good place to take kids, at least kids that know how to behave in public.
